answers.answer: He should talk to a doctor to find out if it's a sign of diabetes or not.  I know the artificial sweetener in diet sodas has other issues of its own.  It's plausible-sounding that it could be diabetes or maybe some kind of kidney issue.

Has he ever tried, experimentally, to cut back a tiny bit at a time to see what happens if he weans himself slowly from the sugars and artificial sweetener?  I don't mean cutting himself off cold turkey, he obviously has found out what happens then, but what if he has a half of a soda less per day for a few weeks, or two or three less sweets every day?  Does he still get such pronounced symptoms?

I'm not a DR but it sounds like hypoglycemia or diabetes - if it's hypoglycemia - it could be caused by diabetes or a range of other conditions.Being that this is combined with weight - he should absolutely see a doctor - perhaps a long time ago.
